entry.title: Python for Zombies: 12.000 enrolled in the first Brazilian MOOC to teach Python
entry.summary:
Description

Experiences of how we spread the Python community in Brazil with a non english MOOC to teach programming. Python for Zombies is the first Massive Open Online Course to teach programming with Python in Portuguese. Our first edition had 12.000 "zombies" enrolled. This course is very different from traditional MOOCs (Edx, Coursera, etc.). First is an initiative of the brazilian Python community. Besides the difference of language, it is very "casual", as I have little time, I recorded most of the videos on my trips between meetings, conferences or at mealtimes. This MOOC is "brazilian", in a non traditional academic way. The size of the videos is far lower than the average traditional courses too. I'm recording the Spanish version. I will show you the most funny codes that I used in MOOC classes to teach programming: hacking basic modules and classes to obtain the "Answer to the Ultimate Question of Life, the Universe, and Everything". All material is Creative Commons Share Alike. The MOOC is based in my experience to teach programming in past six years at FATEC, a public university in Brazil, with decreasing rates of failure in the introduction to programming discipline. We have 100% class in labs, Coding Dojos to training and tests in exercises. Slides for this same title in a talk I gave in Python Education Summit at PyCon Montreal: bit.ly/python-for-zombies

entry.title: Python for Zombies (Brazilian MOOC)
entry.summary:
Description

Python for Zombies: 5000 enrolled in the first Python Brazilian MOOC Python for Zombies is the first free MOOC to learn programming with Python in Brazil. Our first edition had near to 5000 "zombies". A spanish version is possible for next year. Additionally I have been taught programming in past five years at FATEC, a public university in Brazil, with decreasing rates of failure in the introduction to programming discipline. We have 100% class in labs, Coding Dojos to training and we use many funny examples to teach, like hacking Facebook friends photos. Besides the traditional university students we have, at FATEC, special classes for kids in a talent development program of the municipal government.

entry.title: import pybr12: experiencias de inclusión en la última PyCon Brazil
entry.summary:
Description

PyconAR 2016 - Bahía Blanca

import pybr12: experiencias de inclusión en la última PyCon Brazil por Fernando Masanori, Paola Katherine

Audience level: Principiante

Descripción

PyLadies en el Brazil, como un de los fatores para tener 42% de mujeres speaker's, en la ultima PyCon Implementamos el Código de Conduta, como explicado en https://www.coc-handbook.com/ Acertos y errores, en la práctica, do ponto de vista de un miembro del time de respuesta. Explicación del Manifesto Pybr12: sticker con los principios de inclusión de la conferencia 2016

Resumen

  • Contexto de PyLadies en el Brazil: historico, localidades, desarrollo
  • Descripcion particular de PyLadies San Pablo: hace un año de existencia apenas, yo he dado el primero taller, dados y peculiaridades
  • Preliminares de la PyCon Brazil: el Forun Internacional del Software Libre (FISL) donde hube un track solo de mujeres speaker's organizado pelas PyLadies
  • En FISL hubo una chica de doze años entre los speaker's, Larissa Oliva
  • Es la primera experiencia de crowfunding para cobrir los gastos de las chicas (translado, alojamiento), pues muchas eran estudiantes apenas
  • Inicialmente no habia muchas submissiones de mujeres para la PyCon Brazil
  • En las listas internas de discussion de PyLadies se empeza un movimento de brainstorming, surgen muchas ideas para temas de posibles charlas
  • Se empezan las submissiones y una otra campaña de crowfunding, a que se suman tres empresas comos sponsors
  • En la lista de discusión brasileña se llega a un consenso que no es suficiente tener un Código de Conduta, se decide implementarlo como explicado em https://www.coc-handbook.com/
  • Yo he participado en el time de respuesta, relato de los acertos y errores, en la condución del Código de Conduta. Fueron siete las ocorrências.
  • Talleres para iniciantes junto con los sprints.
  • Experiencias compartidas de los organizadores de las PyCon's anterores (una forma de inclusión de los mayores).
  • Explicación del Manifesto Pybr12: sticker con los principios de inclusión de la conferencia 2016. Distribuido a todos los participantes. Manifesto abajo:
  • Respetar a las personas. Las diferencias hacen mejor comunidad mejor. Sea paciente (con los demás, con el diferente, con principiantes). Todos somos diferentes. Todos somos maravillosos. (PyCon Japón). Abraze las causas que usted cree. Ayudar a quienes tienen dificultades. Proteger a las personas que están en necesidad. Personas - Tecnología.
  • Django Girls en la PyCon: intercambio con Anitas, una iniciativa local que logro aumentar la diversidad de las chicas (hube participación de muchas chicas de humanas y biológicas).

Slides

http://ar.pycon.org/proposals/document/15/10467b62-28c9-4603-b3ae-6a299cd14835.pdf

entry.title: Python For Zombies
entry.summary:
Description

Presented by: Fernando Masanori

"15.000 enrolled in the first Brazilian MOOC to teach programming"

Python for Zombies is the first MOOC (Massive Open Online Course) to teach programming in portuguese. Our first edition had 15.000 "zombies". This course is different from traditional MOOCs (Edx, Coursera, etc). First is an initiative of the Brazilian Python community. Besides the difference of language, it is very "casual", as I have little time, I recorded most of the videos on my trips between meetings, conferences or at mealtimes. This MOOC is "brazilian", in a non traditional academic way. The size of the videos is far lower than the average traditional courses too. I will show you the most funny codes that I used in MOOC classes to teach programming: hacking basic modules and classes to obtain the "Answer to the Ultimate Question of Life, the Universe, and Everything". All material is Creative Commons Share Alike. The MOOC is based in my experience to teach programming in past six years at FATEC, a public university in Brazil, with decreasing rates of failure in the introduction to programming discipline. We have 100% class in labs, Coding Dojos to training and tests in exercises. Slides: http://bit.ly/python-for-zombies

entry.title: import community
entry.summary:
Description

Ten different PyCon's and three Django Girls in two year's: lessons on diversity that I learned. Namibia, UK, Japan, Brazil, Italy, Argentina, Uruguay, Germany, Canada, USA and Spain.

Abstract

One of the biggest differences, in the Python community, in relation to other communities, is its effort to improve diversity. There is even a Diversity Statement at PSF: “We have created this diversity statement because we believe that a diverse Python community is stronger and more vibrant. A diverse community where people treat each other with respect has more potential contributors and more sources for ideas.” In last two years I was fortunate enough to take part in ten PyCon’s in eleven different countries: Namibia, UK, Japan, Brazil, Italy, Argentina, Uruguay, Germany, Canada, USA and Spain. Some were not national conferences, but were EuroPython or PyConUS. I was coach in three Django Girls at PyCon Namibia, Argentina and Brazil. I always took note of experiences on how to improve diversity, that could be useful and replicable in my local community and would like to share at PyCon Japan. There are other reports that I also would like to share, which are only beautiful personal stories of how Python reaches the most distant people and places you may never have imagined.

entry.title: Data Structures with Python
entry.summary:
Description

Fernando Masanori - Data Structures with Python [EuroPython 2015] [23 July 2015] [Bilbao, Euskadi, Spain] [Education Summit]

Data Structures is traditionally a “bogeyman” discipline in Computer Science courses and has a high degree of failure. In FATEC São José dos Campos we are adopting a hybrid approach, with C and Python languages. The failure rate decreased from 85% (2008) to 12% (2014). The talk will be extensively illustrated with code in C and Python, addressing the various concepts taught in this course: recursion, linked lists, queues, stacks, sorting algorithms.

entry.title: Python, the next Brazilian generation
entry.summary:
Description

Python for Zombies is the first MOOC (Massive Open Online Course) in portuguese. With a team made up of three folks and no budget, we have reached 30.000 enrollments in one year and half. After having taken the course, some former girl students even founded the first PyLadies groups in Brazil, with great impact in diversity (RuPy Natal: 300+ 1/3 women, Code Girl 2: 700+ 60% women). This MOOC also have a great impact in Python community: I gave 40 talk’s and short courses in 2014!
